src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision

Class GrayImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision.Image
      • src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision.GrayImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Releasable, Writable

    public class GrayImage
extends Image
    This is a gray scale image in a single channel. Its primary use, aside from being an image, is to be a mask. A mask is used to be overlaid onto another image to hide/reveal particular pixels within the other image. In order for a mask to do this, it must be of the same dimensions as the target image. Then the target image and the mask can be placed on top of one another and any pixels of the mask that are black are filtered out of the target image. The only remaining pixels are those where the mask was non-black. It is recommended that users threshold any GrayImage objects before using them as masks to avoid strange and unexpected errors.

        public GrayImage(int width,
                 int height)
        Creates an all black grayscale-formatted image of the supplied dimensions. Width is number of columns, height is number of rows
        Parameters:
        width - width of the image
        height - height of the image
        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • maskBlockAll

        public static GrayImage maskBlockAll(org.opencv.core.Size size)
        Generates a GrayImage that behaves as a mask that blocks all pixels. This means the image is all black.
        Parameters:
        size - size of the returned image
        Returns:
        an all black image

      • maskShowAll

        public static GrayImage maskShowAll(org.opencv.core.Size size)
        Generates a GrayImage that behaves as a mask that reveals all pixels. This means the image is all white.
        Parameters:
        size - size of the returned image
        Returns:
        an all white image

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels(byte[] pixels,
                      int width)
        Sets the pixels of this image to the pixels supplied. Because GrayImage is a single channel image, the pixels, unlike ColorImage.setPixels(byte[], int) are arrayed in the expected manner: {pixel1, pixel2, pixel3, pixel4, etc...} The width is the width of the image the pixels represent. The width does not have to be the width of this image as it is overwritten if it is different.
        Specified by:
        setPixels in class Image
        Parameters:
        pixels - new pixels for this image
        width - width of the new image

      • morphologicalFilter

        public void morphologicalFilter(MorphType morphType,
                                double strength)
        Filters the mask with a morphological filter of the specified type and size. All filters are done with an ellipse shaped template. Filter strength is the same as the size of the template in pixels. Values in the range of 3-20 are typical.
        Parameters:
        morphType - type of filter to use
        strength - strength of filter

        public Image copy()
        Description copied from class: Image
        Deep copy of the image
        Specified by:
        copy in class Image
        Returns:
        copy of the image

      • threshold

        public void threshold(int threshold)
        Returns a masked form of this image. Any pixels below the threshold value are treated as block (black), and above as show (white).
        Parameters:
        threshold - value below which pixels are blocked in the mask

      • relativeThreshold

        public void relativeThreshold(int relativeDifference)
        Returns a masked form of this image where blocked pixels are those that are relatively lower to their neighbors by approximately relativeDifference in value.
        Parameters:
        relativeDifference - approx difference between a pixel and its neighbors to be masked

      • toMaskAutomatic

        public void toMaskAutomatic()
        Returns a masked form of this image where an automatic algorithm attempts to determine which pixels are background and which are foreground. In the resulting mask, background pixels are blocked, foreground pixels are shown. Uses Otsu's method of histogram analysis.

      • threshold

        public void threshold()
        Returns a masked form of this image. Any non-black pixels are treated as show (white), and black pixels as block (black).

      • cvAsGray

        public org.opencv.core.Mat cvAsGray()
